abstract: The stock market tumbled on fears that ills in the mortgage and debt markets will take a wider toll.
snippet: The stock market tumbled on fears that ills in the mortgage and debt markets will take a wider toll.
lead_paragraph: Stocks tumbled today on fears that the worsening ills in the mortgage and debt markets could soon take a significant toll on consumers, businesses and the overall economy.

headline.main: Stocks Fall Sharply Amid Credit Fears

abstract: It was probably only a matter of time before one of the most written-up deals of the summer — Rupert Murdoch’s $5 billion bid for Dow Jones & Company — entered into the rhetoric of presidential hopefuls.
lead_paragraph: It was probably only a matter of time before one of the most written-up deals of the summer — Rupert Murdoch’s $5 billion bid for Dow Jones & Company — entered into the rhetoric of presidential hopefuls.

headline.main: Dow Jones Sale Heats Up Presidential Race

abstract: To clinch Dow Jones and its crown jewel, The Wall Street Journal, Rupert Murdoch had to reach deep: At $60 a share, his bid was 67 percent above the stock’s price before the offer became public in May.
lead_paragraph: To clinch Dow Jones and its crown jewel, The Wall Street Journal, Rupert Murdoch had to reach deep: At $60 a share, his bid was 67 percent above the stock’s price before the offer became public in May.

headline.main: Murdoch, Dow Jones and the ‘Jerk Premium’
